description.narrative: The Kiribati Environment initiative supports a multi-donor climate change program to improve the resilience of Kiribati to the impacts of climate change. The program will strengthen the Government of Kiribati's capacity and extends the multi-phased Kiribati Adaptation Project (KAP), specifically: improving water resource management by installing groundwater abstraction and rainwater harvesting systems, water reticulation management, advisoury support and community awareness programs; increasing coastal resilience by expanding mangrove planting and seawall programs; and increasing the government's capacity to manage effects of climate change by supporting the Strategic Risk Management Unit within the Office of the President. The total value of this initiative is $7.6 million over 3 years, starting 2010-11.
